history.content:
Dear Students, 

If you are a recipient of a Cal Grant, read through this important notice that has an action item. Failure to complete this will result in not being able to register for Fall 2019 classes.

Please direct questions to Cal Student Central since this pertains to financial aid.

--------------------------------------------

As a result of an update in California law, institutions statewide are required to inform California financial aid applicants about the duration of eligibility for Cal Grant awards and clearly communicate the number of units required to graduate within four years (two years for transfer students). The legislation update requires us to collect affirmative student acknowledgement from students confirming that this information was received.

As you may know, the Cal Grant Program provides grants for eligible students who are pursuing an undergraduate degree or vocational or career training that do not have to be repaid. Students may read more information on Cal Grants, including eligibility requirements, on the Financial Aid and Scholarships website. It is important to understand that the upcoming notification in CalCentral will only be for California financial aid applicants, so if a student has never filed or applied, they will not see this notification.

ACTION ITEM: Beginning March 31, 2019, when California financial aid applicants log into CalCentral, they will note an alert. They will be instructed to read statements related to California financial aid, and submit acknowledgement that they have done so. Please encourage them to follow the instructions provided in the alert, and inform them that they may contact Cal Student Central with any technical support needs.

Note that the legislation specifies important details students must be aware of, including that a student should average 30 units per academic year, including summer, to graduate in four years (two years for transfer students) and that Cal Grant eligibility generally is limited to the equivalent of four years of full-time study.

Failure to acknowledge the receipt of this information in CalCentral will result in students being unable to register for classes for the Fall 2019 semester.

If your student does not see this alert in CalCentral, there is no action required on their part.
